metadata.title: CVE-2022-22995 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
The combination of primitives offered by SMB and AFP in their defaultconfiguration allows the arbitrary writing of files. By exploiting thesecombination of primitives, an attacker can execute arbitrary code.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-22995` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

netatalk - 3.1.12~ds-9ubuntu0.22.04.3+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: netatalk package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.1.12~ds-9ubuntu0.22.04.3+esm1').
